name: interpretively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves explaining or understanding the meaning of something: He is technically a brilliant player, but I only wish he had more to offer interpretively. Translation can be done literally, where each word is translated exactly, or interpretively, where the translator tries to give an overall meaning of the paragraph. The entire cast gave a stylish and interpretatively impressive performance.
More examplesFewer examplesThe data was analysed interpretively, using reflection and guiding questions.The concerto is one of the most interpretively challenging works that a young pianist can be asked to perform.She is an excellent performer, who impresses both vocally and interpretively.The orchestra's playing is fluent and interpretatively strong.
